alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:17PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lincoln County through 400 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Boyero, or 26 miles southwest of Flagler, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boyero. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
